events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred at a busy intersection on the morning of May 1. They provided initial details about the accident and requested to file a claim.
After reviewing the reported details, the claim was categorised under 'Auto Accident' following standard procedures related to vehicle collisions.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to assist the customer and guide them through the subsequent process efficiently.
The claim was formally acknowledged and confirmation was sent to the customer with clear instructions on the next steps.
The agent requested the customer to submit photographs of the damaged vehicle along with the police report and any witness statements for investigation.
The customer provided all requested documents, including photos of the impact and the official police collision report, to facilitate the claim review.
The investigation team began assessing the evidence submitted to verify the details of the accident and evaluate liability and damages.
The investigation concluded with a detailed report confirming the insured driver’s claim and estimating the repair costs for the damaged vehicle.
Based on the assessment, a settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering repair expenses and the deductible amount.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the claim handling and communication process.
The claim was formally approved following acceptance of the settlement terms by the customer, confirming the final coverage amount.
The payment was issued promptly to the customer’s account to cover the approved repair costs according to the agreed settlement.
With payment completed and all requirements fulfilled, the claim file was officially closed and documented in the system.
The claim records were archived for future reference following internal compliance and record retention policies.
